Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: From the context, it seems like each case corresponds to a patient's journey through the hospital system. So, events related to the same patient should be grouped together as one case.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Looking at the events, I see that each event has a timestamp, which is in chronological order, and activities like 'Register patient,' 'Initial triage,' 'Doctor consultation,' and so on. These seem like steps in a patient's treatment process.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: One thing to note is that some events share common attributes like patient_age and patient_gender. For example, events 1, 4, 7, 12, and 15 all have patient_age: 45 and patient_gender: M. This suggests that these events might belong to the same patient.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Grouping events based on patient_age and patient_gender combinations, I hypothesize three distinct cases: one for patient_age 45, M, one for patient_age 62, F, and one for patient_age 28, M.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: I compared each patient's journey to ensure that events are logically consistent and occur in an appropriate order for their treatment process.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Analyzing event 12: 'Doctor consultation' at ER for patient_age 45, M, I deduced it aligns logically after the other activities for this patient but in parallel to other cases.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Analyzing event 10: 'Lab test completed,' I confirmed that it follows logically after 'Lab test requested' for patient_age 62, F, consistent with hospital workflows.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: All events for each patient_age and patient_gender align with the appropriate departments (ER for triage and consultation, Surgery for procedures, Radiology for imaging, etc.), further supporting the grouping hypothesis.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Checked for overlapping or inconsistent events. Verified that all events fit neatly into the inferred cases without conflicts.
